required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Carnitine Supplementation and Skeletal Muscle Function
clinical_study.official_title: Carnitine Supplementation and Skeletal Muscle Function in Aging

lead_sponsor.agency: Gdansk University of Physical Education and Sport

clinical_study.source: Gdansk University of Physical Education and Sport

detailed_description.textblock: The project is separated on two studies. Study A: young volunteers (n=40) are supplemented either with carnitine with leucine or carnitine alone for 24 weeks. Before the start, in the mid-point, and after finishing the supplementation the following primary outputs variables are performed: maximal isokinetic knee extensor peak torque (Biodex System 4 Pro), body composition analysis (InBody720), skeletal muscle carnitine concentration, oral glucose tolerance test. Study B: volunteers over 65 years old (n=40) are supplemented either with carnitine or placebo for 24 weeks. Before the start, in the mid-point, and after finishing the supplementation the following primary outputs variables are performed: body composition analysis, blood cytokines and carnitine concentration, blood lipid profile and global physical activity questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Carnitine transport to skeletal muscle cells
secondary_outcome.description: Change in skeletal muscle carnitine concentration

arm_group.description: 24 weeks of l-carnitine-l-tartrate in combination with l-leucine supplementation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with no history of gastrointestinal disorders, cardiovascular disease or hypertension.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects having any illnesses and a history of gastrointestinal disorder, cardiovascular disease, hypertension, liver and renal disease, diabetes, cancer, alcoholism or other metabolic diseases.

overall_official.affiliation: Gdansk University of Physical Education and Sport

facility.name: University of Physical Education and Sport

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Gdansk University of Physical Education and Sport
